header_summary: Davidson introduces the `libfloresta` project, a compact Bitcoin full node for low-power devices.`libfloresta` uses `libbitcoinconsensus` for consensus and plans to utilize `libbitcoinkernel` in the future.GAP600 offers tools to prevent negative impact from full Replace-By-Fee (RBF) in Bitcoin transactions.The email thread proposes solutions to address channel jamming and improve transaction selection and efficiency.

recent_posts.title: Announcing Libforesta
recent_posts.summary:
- Davidson introduces `libfloresta`, a compact Bitcoin full node for low-power devices, written in Rust and compiled to WebAssembly (WASM).
- The project is still in early stages but has been used successfully on signet.
- Davidson plans to write more blog posts and encourages feedback on the project.

recent_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
recent_posts.summary:
- Without a "first seen safe" rule, full Replace-By-Fee (RBF) in Bitcoin transactions is risky for merchants and users who accept 0-conf transactions.
- GAP600 mitigates these risks by requiring replacement transactions to include the original outputs.
- GAP600's strong usage by clients and lack of impact on double spend rates questions the high adoption of full RBF.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions". (ashneverdawn)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email thread discusses whether inscriptions should be considered spam or not.
- The focus should be on privacy, censorship resistance, and treating all transactions equally.
- Economic measures and practical solutions are proposed to prevent inscriptions on the network.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a `keysend` protocol on the Lightning-dev mailing list for multipath payments.
- The scheme involves embedding a preimage in the `keysend` and generating a payment hash.
- This scheme allows the receiver to claim the payment once all parts have arrived.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has been diligently recording and transcribing specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- The transcripts are now available at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification].
- Gurwinder from Chaincode has reviewed and ensured the accuracy of these transcripts.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
recent_posts.summary:
- Participants discussed Bitcoin network policies and potential solutions, including the "top of mempool" assumption.
- Lightning unilateral closes and zero-fee transactions with ephemeral outputs were considered for improvement.
- A hybrid approach to channel jamming mitigation involving monetary measures was proposed and agreed upon.

active_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
active_posts.summary:
- Consensus is leaning towards a flexible TLV format for the taproot annex.
- A non-structured form of the annex would allow immediate utilization for developers.
- This approach offers immediate utilization, future flexibility, and chainspace efficiency for the taproot annex.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation discussed is a blinded version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- In the model of blinded statechains, the server should not learn certain information.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves generating private and public keys and aggregating them.

active_posts.title: On the experiment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives WG and marking this community process "up for grabs"
active_posts.summary:
- Last year, a new community process was introduced to specify covenants after CTV's failure.
- Various initiatives were undertaken, including the establishment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives Working Group.
- The author decided not to pursue the covenant process further but encouraged others to continue.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email updates on channel jamming and provides details for the next call.
- The group plans to gather data on HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking for jamming mitigation.
- Different algorithms for tracking reputation will be experimented with using a proposed reputation scheme.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit that allowed attackers to create balances through invoice manipulation.
- Similar exploits may exist in other Lightning applications, particularly those related to custodial wallets.
- Developers should implement additional checks to ensure invoice details haven't been tampered with.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy for receiving nodes among anonymous users.
- Using these paths may force users to route payments through regulated hubs, affecting decentralization.
- Sharing data by compliant nodes could compromise sender-side privacy through timing analysis.
